newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Colombo low grown tea falls on Middle East fears.
newsitem.headline: Colombo low grown tea falls on Middle East fears.

text.p: Uncertainty in the Middle East over the U.S. missile attacks on Iraq kept low grown tea prices depressed at the Colombo auction on Wednesday, but strong high and medium growns demand remained buoyant, brokers said.
Sri Lanka's distinct low growns, which has its main markets in the Middle East and the CIS, fell two-four rupees due to the prevailing uncertainty in the Middle East, brokers Forbes & Walker said.
But high growns and medium growns picked up by two-four rupees.
The Sri Lankan market's gross sale average price fell slightly to an estimated 118.00 rupees from last week's 118.18 rupees per kilo, which was an all-time high, Forbes and Walker brokers said.
The next auction is on September 10-11 when 4.5 million kg will be on offer.
